00033 #define _USE_MATH_DEFINES // for M_PI

00035 #include "../common/common.h"
00036 #include "../common/kernel.h"
00037 #include "../common/poptmx.h"

00040 using namespace std;

00044 struct clargs {
00045   Path command;               
00046   Contrast contrast;            
00047   int slice;                  
00048   Filter filter_type;           
00049   float center;                   
00050   Path result_name;           
00051   bool beverbose;                               
00052   bool SaveInt;                                 
00053 
00055   clargs(int argc, char *argv[]); 
00056 };
00057 
00058 
00059 clargs::
00060 clargs(int argc, char *argv[]) :
00061   center(0),
00062   beverbose(false),
00063   SaveInt(false),
00064   result_name("reconstructed.tiff")
00065 {
00066 
00067 
00068   poptmx::OptionTable table
00069         ("CT reconstruction of one sinogram picked from the series of images.",
00070          "This program is the prototype of the reconstruct-as-acquired approach."
00071      " In this approach you don't need to wait until all projections are"
00072      " acquired, then form sinogram and reconstruct it. The program picks up"
00073      " the projections (input filenames from the stdin) as they arrive,"
00074      " picks the specified slice and adds to the reconstructed image."
00075      " The end of input data is triggered with the empty line."
00076      );
00077 
00078   table
00079         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "ARGUMENTS:")
00080         .add(poptmx::ARGUMENT, &result_name, "result",
00081                  "Output reconstructed image.", "", result_name)
00082 
00083         .add(poptmx::NOTE, "OPTIONS:")
00084         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &contrast, 'C', "contrast",
00085                  "Input component.",
00086          "Type of the contrast presented in the sinogram. " + Contrast::Desc)
00087         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &slice, 's', "slice",
00088                  "Slice to be reconstructed.", "", "<all>")
00089         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &center, 'c', "center",
00090                  "Rotation center.", CenterOptionDesc, toString(center))
00091         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &filter_type, 'f', "filter",
00092                  "Filtering window used in the CT.", FilterOptionDesc, filter_type.name())
00093         .add(poptmx::OPTION, &SaveInt,'i', "int",
00094          "Output image(s) as integer.", IntOptionDesc)
00095         .add_standard_options(&beverbose)
00096         .add(poptmx::MAN, "SEE ALSO:", SeeAlsoList);
00097 
00098   if ( ! table.parse(argc,argv) )
00099         exit(0);
00100   if ( ! table.count() ) {
00101         table.usage();
00102         exit(0);
00103   }
00104 
00105   command = table.name();
00106 
00107   if ( ! table.count(&slice) )
00108         exit_on_error(command, string () +
00109                                   "Missing required argument: "+table.desc(&slice)+".");
00110 
00111 }
00112 
00113 
00114 
00115 int imageSlice;   
00116 
00117 
00118 
00131 static int
00132 getLine(Line & sinoline, float & Theta) {
00133 
00134   string input;
00135   getline(cin, input);
00136 
00137   if ( input.empty() )
00138     return 0; // end of input
00139 
00140   Path projname;
00141   istringstream ist(input);
00142   ist >> Theta >> projname;
00143 
00144   static Shape expectedShape(0,0);
00145 
00146   if ( ! blitz::product(expectedShape) ) { // first run only
00147     expectedShape = Shape(ImageSizes(projname));
00148     if ( expectedShape(0) < imageSlice )
00149       throw_error("ct-line", "The slice to be reconstructed"
00150                   " (" + toString(imageSlice) + ") is out of the"
00151                   " image height ("+ toString(expectedShape(0)) + ").");
00152     sinoline.resize(expectedShape(1));
00153   }
00154 
00155   ReadImageLine(projname, sinoline, imageSlice, expectedShape);
00156 
00157   return 1;
00158 
00159 }
00160 
00161 
00162 
00164 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00165 
00166   const clargs args(argc, argv) ;
00167   imageSlice = args.slice;
00168 
00169   float Theta;
00170   Line sinoline;
00171 
00172   if ( ! getLine(sinoline, Theta) )
00173     throw_error("ct-line", "Could not read from input.");
00174 
00175   int pixels = sinoline.size();
00176   Map result( pixels, pixels );
00177   const CTrec rec(pixels, args.contrast, args.filter_type);
00178 
00179   ProgressBar pbar(args.beverbose, "Reconstructing");
00180 
00181   do {
00182     rec.addLine(sinoline, result, Theta * M_PI / 180.0, args.center);
00183     pbar.update();
00184   } while (  getLine(sinoline, Theta) );
00185 
00186   pbar.done();
00187 
00188   SaveImage(args.result_name, result, args.SaveInt);
00189   
00190   exit(0);
00191 
00192 }
